intro: Hemitelia suprastrigosa, commonly known as the hairy hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Hemitelia suprastrigosa is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas.
